item.title: Well Street building external lights not on at sun down, 28th January
item.description:
This has been an ongoing issue that never seems to be fixed. The external building lights do not turn on at the same time as the other buildings in the estate. The entire building is in complete darkness when the sun goes down.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Well Street, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lime bike blocking double cycle lanes entering Old Woolwich Road, 28th January
item.description:
One lime bike was just left over the cycling lanes off Woolwich Road, effectively blocking both lanes for bikes. This is so inconsiderate and hinders cycling, when will the council review their shared use bike policy, they are being left all over pavements and other extremely inconvenient places all over the borough. Will lime take the responsibility and penalise the user? I've included the QR code of this particular bike

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 75, Lassell Street, East Greenwich, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Upper Wickham Lane, East Wickham, Greater London

item.title: Concern regarding pedestrian access through Abchurch Lane (Cannon Street ↔ King William Street) and Nicholas Lane, adjacent to the Bank Station Elizabeth Line entrance., 28th January
item.description:
Although I note that Abchurch Lane appears on the City’s road closures list, the operational barriers and temporary hoardings currently in place are obstructing what should be a public pedestrian route — particularly on the Nicholas Lane side which is only passable in one direction due to incremental narrowing. This has been the case for many months, and there is no clear alternative pedestrian route provided that allows two-way flow while maintaining safe access to/from the station. I have also not been able to locate a specific TTRO reference number or published notice for Nicholas Lane’s closure in the online City traffic orders listings. Can you please confirm: • The TTRO reference number(s) authorising the current closures / restrictions for Abchurch Lane and Nicholas Lane; • The start/end dates of those orders; • The full traffic management plan, including alternative pedestrian provision and measures taken to ensure safety and accessibility for all users; and • Whether appropriate public notices (as required under the Road Traffic Regulation Act 1984) have been displayed at the affected locations. This route is an important and well-used pedestrian access to a major transport hub. The current arrangement is effectively narrowing one side to the point where two-way pedestrian flow is unsafe and inhibits access for people with mobility needs. I would be grateful for your earliest clarification and corrective action if required. Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Nicholas Lane, City of London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: A Number of Pot Holes, 28th January
item.description:
The potholes have increasingly got worse the longer they have been left. You can’t see them in the dark so many cars can’t avoid them resulting in exhaust pipes getting damaged. They are on a stretch of road in Ashmore Grove between Eastcote Road and Sundridgd Avenue.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ashmore Grove, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large Subsidence / sink hole that is getting worse in road on Merton Gardens., 28th January
item.description:
The road / kerbing / pavement has dropped significantly (see pics attached). This appears to also be causing issues with Foul Sewer pipework (for example some houses had to have their Foul Sewer Manhole by the pavement pumped as was overflowing.

item.title: Street lighting not working, 28th January
item.description:
None of the street lights surrounding Newland House and Dalton House on John Williams Close are working. This is making the area unsafe. I dont know when then started, but I noticed this week NONE of the street lights are working. As you come into John Williams Close SE14, its the first road off to the right.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Cold Blow Lane, New Cross Gate, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Yet again collection not properly done, 28th January
item.description:
Each and every week this is what the refuse / recycling team leave behind at the top of Trinity Street! How many times does this have to be reported. This area was due to be under increased scrutiny but that has fallen by it seems. Clear boxes with addresses labels on show but nothing done about it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 305, Trinity Street, The Borough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
